captions.text: Hi guys! It's Brooklyn and Bailey,
and today we are going to be doing another book review.
Um, today I have a book called "It All Started With an Apple".
And I have "Defy".
And we both just recently read these and we loved them,
so we are going tell you all about them!
Um, this book actually started out as a WattPad book.
Watt pad is an online website where..um..
It's not a website it's an app. It's an app or a website.
But it's where like unprofessional authors
or, like, me, or like a young 14-year old,
can go on there and upload {write a story}
chapters of their own books, and write a story basically.
And they're unpublished and they're like, um...
they're kind of just like... they kind of just, like, basic writing, you know, ideas.
And so this started out on there
and I actually read it for the first time
on that website,
but it just recently got published as a real book!
and it is so good.
It's actually written by Ashley Winters.
She's 16... a sixteen year old wrote this book!
It's crazy! And I loved it!
It's about a girl named Brianne,
and how she really doesn't feel like she has a love life,
but then her best friend convinces her to throw this
apple across the room in the cafeteria.
And it hit this guy on the head,
Dannon,
and... KABOOM! (Voila)
They have a romantic relationship!
It is one of the, one of the best books I've ever read.
They go through some struggles,
and I just love this book so much! It was amazing!
I would recommend it for any age,
It's really appropriate.
There's nothing really wrong with this book.
I mean, I just, I just loved it!
It's one of my favorites so far.
And my book is called Defy.
It's more of action based.
And, um...
its about a girl named Alexa
and her and her twin brother, um...
their parents die.
So, the only options for them. is for either, um...
both of them to become fighters,
but girls are not allowed to become fighters.
So Alexa pretends...
Well, she means soldiers not fighters. Yeah soldiers.
So Alexa has to pretend to be a boy,
and she is fighting um, in the king's army.
She's like trying to, um, hide herself,
and pretend to be a boy,
and also learn the skills of a soldier
while being in the prince's um.. personal guard.
Personal guard.
It's really good!
I would recommend it for any age
really, it's really appropriate.
And it's got a lot of action in it,
and a lot of romance!
So, I would definitely recommend this book
for any of you guys out there!
Thank you guys so much for watching our book review!
Don't forget to follow us on Twitter,
@BrookAndBailey
And, also, don't forget to leave a comment below
on the books you guys want us to read!
And, we'll see you next week!
Bye! Bye!
Happy 6th Birthday to Daxton! The best little brother in the world!
Click here to SUBSCRIBE!
Click above to see our Airplane Essentials video!
Thank you, from BrooklynAndBailey!
Mom teaching Bailey how to read at age 4! We have loved reading ever since!

comments.text:
First off, Happy (VERY LATE) Birthday Daxton!!
The Secrets of the Immortal Nicholas Flamel
by Michael Scott (It's a series of 6 books)

1. The Alchemyst
2. The Magician
3. The Sorceress
4. The Necromancer
5. The Warlock
6. The Enchantress

Really love it! (finished it last summer) and I personally think it's good 
for maybe 11-12 and up. It take gods and goddesses from all kinds of myths 
and forms an adventure that could possibly end the peace of humanity.
Completely fascinated with this series and you guys NEED to review it! I'm 
not even joking. ﻿
